culturalAndHeritage.title: Cultural And Heritage
culturalAndHeritage.seoTitle: Top cultural sites to visit in Pakistan

details.title: Ancient Silk Route
details.description: The ancient Silk route tour is crafted to show you the ancient trade route which links China with Pakistan. This tour will start from Islamabad and end at Khunjerab China Border. You will visit the legendary cities, lush green meadows, religious sites and rich museums. Moreover, you will interact with local the communities living along the ancient silk route

whatsIncluded.covid: Covid-19  Essentials ( Hand Sanitizer, Masks, Gloves)

whatsNotIncluded.visa: Visa  ( Supporting credentials will be provided)
whatsNotIncluded.tips: Tips to guide and support staff

details.title: Buddhist Traces
details.description: The tour is crafted specifically for those who are keen to explore the rich Buddhist Traces in Pakistan.  You will be able to see the Historical Lahore City, Famous Katas Raj Temple, Beautiful Islamabad, Cradle of Buddhism Taxila, Rich Buddhist Sites of Takht e Bai, well preserved remains of Bddhists in Peshawar Museum and Lush green Buddhist Sites of Swat

whatsIncluded.covid: Covid-19  Essentials ( Hand Sanitizer, Masks, Gloves)

whatsNotIncluded.visa: Visa  ( Supporting credentials will be provided)
whatsNotIncluded.tips: Tips to guide and support staff

details.title: Cultural Tour South Pakistan
details.description: South Pakistan Tour is a combination of Heritage, Cultural and religious sites tour. You will explore the glorious heritage sites of Pakistan. From the Cultural sites of Pakistan to the rich Islamic Architecture, from the Indus civilizations to the Gandhara remains. You will experience the perfect taste of Pakistani Culture and Heritage

details.title: Gandhara Civilization Tour 1
details.description: The traces of Gandhara civilization are found at the rich archeological sites of Peshawar, Taxila, Swat, Mardan, Dir, Malakand and other parts of Khyber Pakhtoonkhwa province. The Gandhara Civilization was not only the core of spiritual influence but also the cradle of Gandhara art, culture and Teachings. During the tour we will visit these rich sites and museums that give the true taste of Gandhara Civilization

details.title: Indus Civilization Tour
details.description: Pakistan is a home to one of the ancient  human civilizations of the world that flourished 4500 years prior alongside the Indus river.  From the capital of Pakistan to the metropolitan city Karachi Pakistan. The Visit is a combination  of wide range of societies and ethnic groups of Pakistan with their rich customs.  The visit incorporates visits to the Museums, the minarets, tombs of saints, mosques and World Heritage Sites

details.title: Kalash Festivals
details.description: There are three types of Cultural Festivals celebrated in Kalash. These festivals are; Chilam Joshi, Uchal and Choimus. Chilim Joshi is celebrated in spring (May), Uchal is Celebrated in Summer (August) and Choimus is celebrated in Winter (December). UNESCO declared the Kalash culture as Intangible Cultural Heritage. The unique culture attracts visitors from across the world

details.title: Pakistan Heritage Sites Tour 1
details.description: Pakistan is known for its rich cultural history. UNESCO declared the top cultural sites as its heritage. Our Clients can explore the rich Cultural traces of Pakistan which includes; Taxila Heritage Sites, Rohtas Fort, Lahore Fort, Harappa,  Mohan Jo Dero and Makli Hills

details.title: Shandur Polo Festival
details.description: Shandur polo festival is one of the most famous festivals of Pakistan. The festival is help in the month of July each year.  Polo match is played between Gilgit and Chitral Teams on the ‘Highest Polo ground of the World”. During these three festivals folk music are played and local artists show their cultural dancing and singing skills

details.title: Sikh Yatra Tour
details.description: Pakistan is the cradle of Sikh Heritage. This not only a tour but a spiritual journey during which the soul is purified, mind and body is re-energized.  During this spiritual journey Yatras will visit the holy places in Pakistan

details.title: Sufi Sites Tour
details.description: The tour is designed to give our clients insight of Muslim Saints and Sufis Traces in Pakistan. During this journey we will cover the major Sufi and Religious sites of Pakistan. Which Includes, Badshahi Masjid, Masjid Wazir Khan, Baha Uddin Zikaria , Shah Rukn e Alam, Shamsuddin Sabzwari , Shah Gardez, Uch Sharif, Bibi Javindi, Shahbaz lal Qalandar Shrine, Sehwan Sharif, Shah Jahan Mosque and Makli Graveyard

itinerary.title: Fly to Islamabad/ Drive to Chilas

whatsIncluded.transport: All domestic flights and road transfers including airport transfers
whatsIncluded.hotel: All hotel accommodation in Pakistan (twin sharing room)
whatsIncluded.tent: All trekking accommodation in Pakistan (twin sharing dome tent)
whatsIncluded.campingFee: All camping site fees and bridge fees
whatsIncluded.trekingLogistics: All trekking logistics (all tents, non-personal equipment and tools etc)
whatsIncluded.meals: All meals (breakfast, lunch & dinner) and beverages/water during meals
whatsIncluded.snacks: Snacks including dry fruits and tea/coffee during the trek
whatsIncluded.water: Refills of boiled drinking water on the trek
whatsIncluded.trekPermits: Government trekking permit fees and paperwork
whatsIncluded.porter: Porter for personal luggage (14kgs) and mountaineering equipment (8kgs)
whatsIncluded.certificates: Trekking map and trip achievement certificate

whatsNotIncluded.visa: Visa  ( Supporting credentials will be provided)
whatsNotIncluded.personalItems: Personal equipment (e.g. trekking shoes, down jacket, walking sticks etc)
whatsNotIncluded.mountainItems: Personal mountain equipment (crampon, mountaineering boot, ice axe, harness, two carabiners, helmet etc)
whatsNotIncluded.extraStay: Extra nights in Islamabad (hotel check in/out is 12pm) - additional USD 49 per night
whatsNotIncluded.tips: Tips/gratuities for guides, porters, staff etc
whatsNotIncluded.items: Miscellaneous (minibar, bottled water, phone calls, laundry, souvenir etc)
